>
[Flame Drake Snare](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1127)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Clockwork" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=331" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Mechanical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=105" />
<trait label="Snare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=146" />
<trait label="Trap" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=158" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 79 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) All Pathfinder Society agents have access to all uncommon clockwork items and gadgets from Chapters 1 and 2 of this book_

**Price** 25 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

**Access** Characters from Absalom, New Thassilon, Alkenstar, Dongun Hold, or especially technological regions of Arcadia like the Deadshot Lands have access to uncommon clockwork items from the first two chapters of this book.

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The snare takes the form of a Tiny, [drake](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=36)-like clockwork toy. When a creature enters its square the snare activates, causing the drake to spit a gout of fire in a 15-foot cone in the direction from which the creature entered. For instance, if a creature entered the square coming from the east, the cone would point east, to hit any allies behind the triggering creature. Those within the cone must succeed a DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save or take 6d6 fire damage. After spitting its fire, the snare falls apart.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
